meanings.definition: Repair or fix something that is broken or damaged.
meanings.sent1: I will mend my torn shirt with a needle and thread.
meanings.sent2: She used glue to mend the broken vase.
meanings.sent3: Trying to mend a broken heart with superglue won't work.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words helped mend the rift between them.
meanings.sent5: The skilled craftsman could mend anything with his tools.

meanings.sent1: Studying hard can help you mend your grades.
meanings.sent2: With practice, his piano playing began to mend.
meanings.sent3: Eating vegetables can mend your health in a tasty way.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude helped mend the situation.
meanings.sent5: A good night's sleep can mend your mood like magic.

meanings.definition: To heal or recover from an injury or illness.
meanings.sent1: Resting will help you mend faster after the flu.
meanings.sent2: The doctor's treatment plan helped him mend quickly.
meanings.sent3: A warm bowl of soup can mend a cold in no time.
meanings.sent4: Her care and love helped him mend from the accident.
meanings.sent5: The medicine worked like a charm to mend his broken leg.
